commits.message: Fixed Info div width on Firefox
Switched over to THREE-CSM for the waves

issue.title: Perlin and simplex noises (fbm) gets abruptly cut off on mobile, ridge noise does not work
issue.body:
As per title, looks like the lower heights for perlin and simplex noises gets all cutted off on mobile devices.

Ridge noise does not work at all (displays a black plane if I switch on 2d mode)

Using a OnePlus 6T with Android 10



![Screenshot_20210515-084133~2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1405327/118352491-ad59ea80-b559-11eb-9496-aef0e25563e5.jpg)
![Screenshot_20210515-084149~2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1405327/118352492-adf28100-b559-11eb-8b1d-b8cbc8aca295.jpg)

comment.body:
Update: glNoise no longer specifies the precision. it is left to the user. However, this issue still seems to persist. 

Will leave this open as I do not have a device that the bug affects.

commits.message: Made it so that the plane does not drown on mobile
Fixed Demo on Firefox and Opera

release.body:
## Version 1.2.0

### Breaking

- Renamed `gln_tVoronoiOpts -> gln_tVoronoiOpts`
- Moved `gln_tVoronoiOpts` from the `Common` to the `Worley` chunk. 

### Changed

- Added Gerstner Waves
release.short_description_html:
Version 1.2.0

Breaking

  • Renamed gln_tVoronoiOpts -> gln_tVoronoiOpts
  • Moved gln_tVoronoiOpts from the Common to the Worley chunk.

Changed

  • Added Gerstner Waves

payload.description: A collection of GLSL noise functions for use with WebGL with an easy to use API.
